intro: Ononis natrix proles concolor, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rosaceae. It is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, lanceolate leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of white to pale pink flowers with five petals, which bloom in early summer. It thrives in dry, sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as rocky slopes and disturbed areas. This species is native to Europe and parts of western Asia, and it is often used in traditional herbal medicine.
